text: Albert C. "Big Train" Johnson Jr. (August 20, 1913 – February 2, 1991) was an American professional basketball player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Chicago Studebaker Flyers in one game during the 1942–43 season. He also played in independent leagues, including a stint on the Harlem Globetrotters. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1991 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from Illinois Category:Chicago Studebaker Flyers players Category:Forwards (basketball) Category:Harlem Globetrotters players Category:Sportspeople from Chicago
title: Al Johnson (basketball)
